actions.committee: Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works.

official_title: A bill to require that competitions be conducted to enhance the Nation's architecture and determine the design of certain new Federal office buildings.

summary.text: Architectural Excellence Act of 1979 - Amends the Public Buildings Act of 1959 to require the General Services Administrator to use at least one percent of the estimated cost of a public building, which is estimated to cost in excess of $25,000,000 to finance a competition to determine the design of such building. Directs the Administrator to award a price to the winner of such competition. Requires the Administrator to appoint a panel to determine the most appropriate design.

titles.title: A bill to require that competitions be conducted to enhance the Nation's architecture and determine the design of certain new Federal office buildings.
